intro: Senecio anacampserotis, commonly known as the Blue-Eyed Mary, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a flowering plant characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that resemble miniature daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Senecio anacampserotis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
